===Alternative forms===
* {{l|mul|犭}} (when used as a left Chinese radical)

Although the alternative form clearly shows only three strokes, it is still counted as four strokes when using a Chinese dictionary. Compare [[氵]] from {{m|mul|水||water|sc=Hani}}, [[扌]] from {{m|mul|手||hand|sc=Hani}}, and [[忄]] from {{m|mul|心||heart|sc=Hani}}, all of which are a 3-stroke form from a 4-stroke character.

===Han character===
{{Han char|rn=94|rad=犬|as=00|sn=4|four=43030|canj=IK|ids=⿻大丶}}

# {{mul-kangxi radical-def}}

====Usage notes====
犬 is the 94th radical in the Chinese dictionary. Compound characters such as [[狇]] mostly use the alternative form at the left of the character. Most represent something to do with dogs or other animals. A smaller proportion (e. g. [[狀]]) use the primary form at the right of the character. A few even show both forms: in [[獄]] which means "prison" or "litigation"; "words" ([[言]]) stand between two dogs to keep them from biting each other.

====Derived characters====
* [[Index:Chinese radical/犬]]
* [[默]] ([[黙]]) [[䭾]]

[[Image:YellowLabradorLooking_new.jpg|thumb|A dog (a [[Labrador]])]]

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – the dot is the ear. In the form {{zh-l|*犭}}, a dog that is up on its hind legs.

===Etymology===
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*d-kʷəj-n||dog}}.

This common Sino-Tibetan word has been replaced by {{och-l|狗}} in most dialects except a few Min dialects, such as [[w:Fuzhou dialect|Fuzhou]] ''kēng''. In other dialects, this word is mainly found in compounds and not used alone.

===Etymology===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{wikipedia|Dog}}
[[File:Coat_types_3.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|犬}} (''inu''): various kinds of '''[[dog]]'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|いぬ|yomi=k}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=いぬ}}. Derivation uncertain. Various theories exist, including derivation from ancient verb {{m|ja|往ぬ|tr=inu||to leave, to be gone}}, from the way a dog will guard the house while the master is away; from a compound of {{m|ja|家|tr=ie||house, home}} + {{m|ja|寝|tr=nu||to sleep|pos=ancient monosyllabic form of modern {{m|ja|寝る}} ''neru''}}; from ancient Japanese {{m|ja|狗|tr=enu||puppy, dog}}, itself of uncertain derivation; or as a borrowing from some other unknown language.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|いぬ|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}
